borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The proposed development, by reason of design, scale and siting, would unacceptably result in an overbearing impact on 98 Romsey Road, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); and

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

The proposal, by reason of design, siting and scale, would be an undesirable addition, would look not subservient to the original dwelling, affect the existing symmetry of the terrace block, and inevitably cause unacceptable disturbance to the street scene when viewed public vantage points on Romsey Road. In addition, within the Becontree Estate context, the proposed side extension would also close a gap that contributes positively to the local character, and consequently cause harm to the local distinctiveness. The proposal is thus contrary to the following policies which seek to ensure that development is of a high quality, respectful to local character and appearance, and sympathetic to the historic character:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D1/8 & HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policies CP2/3 & CR2 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP2/11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- Policies SPP6 & DMD1/4/6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); and

- Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)
description: Construction of a two storey side extension and single storey rear extension
